message.content:
A pomegranate is a fruit that belongs to the family Lythraceae.
It is round, roughly the size of an apple, and has a thick, leathery skin.
The skin is typically a deep shade of red or pink.
Inside, the fruit is divided into sections filled with small, juicy seeds known as arils.
The arils are pinkish-red and surrounded by a small, white membrane.
Pomegranates are commonly used in cuisine and can be found in many Mediterranean and Middle Eastern dishes.
They are also a popular ingredient in juices and cocktails.
